alert.note: Alert for Teton (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 10:34AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following river in Wyoming... Pacific Creek near Moran affecting Teton County. .Mountain snowmelt will slow due to cooler temperatures, with rain showers expected into the weekend. Overall, water levels on Pacific Creek will show little change through the weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...Pacific Creek near Moran. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor low level flooding along lower banks. At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. Flooding of upstream USFS campground on right bank. Minor lowland flooding intensifies and becomes more widespread. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Friday, June 2, the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will hover around action stage into the weekend, generally remaining between 6.7 and 7.1 feet. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay away from riverbanks, which may be eroded by the fast-moving water and could easily collapse.
